body:
Day 11 - Manga 252*
The art was actually pretty good, there were few moments that I didnt like to see. One problem, however is how big the story is in relation to the hentai. Had it been a normal day and I decided to read this, I would stop halfway since I would have come here to masturbate. The story, nevertheless, was pretty wholesome and sad at the same time and let us see a human man, not a 2D character, how he things, how he feels, how he fears, everything and that was pretty cool. The suicide at the end was a good way to end this too since it let's us see the consequences of his actions, saving one girl meant letting the other "drown". It also let's us see a time travel of sorts well done, the future that he saw was one but since he altered the past, it all changed.
Overhaul it was a beautifully done work and, other than the long story and the somewhat out of place font that broke my immersion, it was good.
9/10.
This was the best one I've read so far in this pointless journey 10/10

Same.
At least we have this.
Came back to re-read this beautiful shit after Anno played us like a damn fiddle. Curse you Anno. 8 years worth of wait. Where is Asushin? Goddamn it. Why? Why?
This is fucking incredible. The story really feels canon
Masterpiece, love it, this is what the movie should be end like
i came looking for some hentai but stayed for the story instead, the story is at another level

This should be on webtoon not nhentai, its so good.
 Also that DDLC flashback lol
Damn, I watched gigguk's video on hentai and he mentioned this, pretty sweet recomendation!
Seen asuka and Shinji together make me happy but and the same time I'm so sad for rei..
Don't tell me this is it. There's no more ???
This is what the movies should of been like
